children.subject: I would suggest against it, it doesn't sound very fun. CS 61B is higher workload than CS 61A, EE 16A and EE 16B are about the same workload, and CS 70 will be definitely more difficult and more work than Math 53. Maybe if your current semester was pretty manageable for you and you will have no extracurricular commitments next semester, you could do it but it would be decently rough.

history.content: I took EE16B with Professor Sahai so I can't really speak about Prof Arcak/Sanders as different professors focus on different topics etc. However, EE16B and CS70 will have weekly hw, both of which require a lot of time as they are pretty challenging. It would be terrible if the due dates are the same for both classes as you will have to split your time and really stay on top of everything. Again I took CS61B with Professor Hug, but CS61B will also require a lot of time as the concepts are super important and require time to understand them. CS61B will be a heavy class in terms of workload as you will have labs, hw, and projects. As far as difficulty is concerned, that varys from student to student. I personally found it easy, however I know a lot of students who thought otherwise. I also took it with Professor Hug, who usually offers more "scaffolding" on assignments where as Professor Hilfinger is known to offer less scaffolding. So that is also something to consider as you will be spending a lot more time on projects. If these deadlines are on the same day as EE16B and CS70 that would be death. That is not to say that it isn't "doable". That answer really depends on you. It is helpful to have other friends who are in the same boat but at the end of the day it is your decision.

children.subject: did this combo as well and agree with ^

I'm going to give a different outlook. I took this exact combo and a couple extracurriculars last semester (10 hr/week). Overall it was very doable but be weary if you're not the best person at time management. You will have weeks where you have two midterms and a bunch of hw or projects due. Also, keep in mind 16b lab is no joke, nothing like 16a. Overall, I'd say that if you are motivated and enjoy the material definitely go for it, you will learn a lot.

history.content:
Hi! I was wondering how feasible it is to take all three of these classes concurrently next semester? I'm generally an A-/sometimes A student who's currently taking 61A, 16A, and Math 53 this semester. Most of my friends are going to take all three, and this seems to be very common, but I'm still very worried about how I can survive. Any advice from those who've done these courses would be awesome!

If it helps, as of now the professors for these classes in Spring 2020 are:

EE16B: Arcak, Sanders

CS61B: Hilfinger

CS70: Ayazifar, Tygar
history.subject: EE16B, CS61B, and CS70 concurrently?
